title: Understanding Chromatography
text: Chromatography is a technique used to separate components in a mixture. It relies on the differential partitioning between the mobile and stationary phases.

title: Types of Chromatography
text: Besides gas and liquid chromatography, there are other forms such as thin-layer chromatography (TLC), ion-exchange chromatography, and size-exclusion chromatography.

title: Thin-Layer Chromatography (TLC)
text: TLC involves a stationary phase of a thin layer of adsorbent material on a flat, inert substrate. The mobile phase is a solvent that moves up the plate by capillary action.

title: Identifying TLC
text: Which of the following is a form of chromatography not based on gas or liquid phases?
